issues.description: The problem statement requires Bitmap24 to provide a constructor Bitmap24(std::string filename) for loading existing images and states the width/height constructor is deprecated (problem_statement.md lines 25-26). However neither the template nor the solution repositories declare or implement such a filename constructor. Both repositories only declare/implement Bitmap24() and Bitmap24(int,int). This is a structural mismatch: students are told to implement or rely on a constructor that does not exist in the provided code, which will confuse them and block work that depends on loading images from a filename.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the problem, template, and solution consistent. Either (A) update the template and solution to declare and implement the required constructor, or (B) change the problem statement to remove/alter the requirement.

Recommended (A): Add a filename constructor declaration to Bitmap24.hpp and a corresponding implementation in Bitmap24.cpp. Example guidance for the header:
- Add: Bitmap24(const std::string &i_filename); // loads image from file

In Bitmap24.cpp implement a loader (or a small stub that throws a clear runtime_error if not implemented) that opens the file, parses the expected BMP/scene format and initializes width, height and data. Mark the width/height constructor as deprecated in the header comment (or annotate with [[deprecated]] if using C++14+), and update any example/main code or tests to show usage of the filename constructor when appropriate. This resolves the mismatch while preserving the educational intent to teach image loading via the filename constructor.

issues.description: Problem statement requires a constructor Bitmap24(std::string filename) on the Bitmap24 class to load existing images, but both the template and solution code only declare/implement Bitmap24() and Bitmap24(int i_width, int i_height). The conceptual entity 'constructor for loading an existing image (filename)' is named explicitly in the problem but is absent (and therefore not mappable) in the code artifacts. Students cannot directly map the problem requirement to a corresponding constructor in the template; this is an API/name mismatch between the problem description and the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Add the requested constructor declaration Bitmap24(std::string filename); to Bitmap24.hpp and provide an implementation in Bitmap24.cpp that loads the image file. Keep or mark the width/height constructor deprecated as the statement indicates. Ensure the parameter name is 'filename' and the signature matches the problem statement so students can directly map the requirement to the provided API.
